item.description:
We'll launch at Artesani Park in Brighton then paddle up the Charles River to Watertown. Total distance (round trip is approx 7 miles) all flat, non-tidal water. If people want to go further you can portage at the dam and continue to Newton another approx 3 1/2 miles. Charles River Watershed Association One of the oldest watershed associations in the country, Charles River Watershed Association (CRWA) was formed in 1965 in response to public concern about the degraded condition of the Charles. Since it earliest days of advocacy, CRWA has spearheaded major clean-up and watershed protection efforts. Initiatives over the past three decades have dramatically improved water quality in the watershed while enhancing public access to the river and protection of parklands. For more information on CRWA, visit their website at http://www.crwa.org A century ago civic leaders converted polluted tidal flats and industrialized shores along the Charles River into a world-renowned water park—the Charles River Basin. From Watertown Dam in Watertown, to Charles River Dam at Boston Harbor, the Basin offers nine miles of public access to the river and its historic parkland. With recreational opportunity on this scale in the heart of metropolitan Boston, it is no wonder the Charles River Basin is a treasured resource.

Charles River Map pdf

http://www.paddleboston.com/boston/map.php

http://maps.google.com/maps?f=d&hl=en&saddr=&daddr=Soldiers+Field+Rd+%26+Everett+St,+Brighton,+MA+02135,+us&ie=UTF8&t=h&z=16
item.how_to_find_us: Large Parking area, will be easy to find the group.
item.name: Charles River Paddle Brighton to Newton
